rules

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • rules.Rule

  • public class Rule
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the transition rules of a Automaton. Rules are encoded in arrays of non-negative integers up to the cardinality of the neighborhood of the CellArray that underlies the client Automaton.
    Author:
    Zach Tidwell
    See Also:
    Notation for rules, {@link topology.Topology2D.Base Base}

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean ignoreBoundary
      Boolean indicating if this Rule should ignore Boundaries when computing transitions.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rule(int[] B, int[] S)
      Creates a Rule from two int arrays that carry the conditions for the transition of Cells to the next state for each iteration of the client Automaton.
      Rule(int[] B, int[] S, boolean ignoreBoundary)
      Creates a Rule from two int arrays that carry the conditions for the transition of Cells to the next state for each iteration of the client Automaton.
